markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 4Â tbspÂ boiling water

Dry Ingredients

  • 3/4Â cupÂ (100Â g)Â almond flour
  • 2Â tbspÂ psyllium husk powder
  • 1Â tspÂ baking powder
  • 1Â tspÂ black sesame seeds
  • 1Â tspÂ white sesame seeds
  • 2Â tspÂ sunflower seeds
  • 1Â tspÂ black chia seeds
  • 1/2Â tspÂ Himalayan salt
  • 1/2Â tspÂ garlic powder

Wet Ingredients

  • 1Â egg
  • 2Â egg whites
  • 1Â tbspÂ apple cider vinegar
  • 3Â tbspÂ melted refined coconut oil

Steps:

  • Preheat the oven to 180C.
  • In a bowl, mix the dry ingredients with a whisk. In a separate bowl, mix the wet ingredients. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix with a silicone spatula.
  • Slowly pour in the boiling water and continue mixing. The dough will be quite thick and expand as it absorbs the water.
  • Separate the dough into 5 and form 5 balls with your hands (the batter is pretty sticky).Â You can spray some olive oil on your hands to make the dough not stick to you.
  • Place the balls over parchment paper on a baking tray and bake for 30 minutes. Take out and let cool before serving or you'll burn your fingers! These come out piping hot!

frontmatter.title: Low Carb Psyllium Husk Bread Rolls
